;;黄昏时分，加利福尼亚州索拉诺县乡村的一座风电场，8 月星期三2023 年 3 月 30 日。（美联社照片/Godofredo A. Vásquez）;
;

;一群技术投资者最近公布了在加利福尼亚州旧金山和萨克拉门托之间创建一个新的“绿色”城市的计划。

;

;该团体的名称是“永远的加州”。该公司在其同名网站上发布了这些计划。领导者是金融服务公司高盛的前交易员 Jan Sramek。

;

;California Forever 已在索拉诺县购买了价值约 8 亿美元的土地。该县包括小城市、许多农场和一个美国军事基地。

;

;该地区距旧金山约 100 公里，距州首府萨克拉门托 50 公里。该县约有 45 万人居住。中层住宅的成本约为 60 万美元，而靠近旧金山的住宅可能要贵两到三倍。住房供应是加州最令人担忧的问题之一，而那些担任教师、护士或警察的人无法住在工作地点附近。

;
;;;在这张航拍照片中，牛群在山坡上吃草，背景是加利福尼亚州索拉诺县乡村的风电场。 2023 年 3 月 30 日。（美联社照片/Terry Chea）;
;

;《永远的加州》的公告以这样的信息开头：“开始关于索拉诺县东部的对话。一个新社区的机会、高薪的当地工作、太阳能发电场和开放空间。”

;

;该帖子包含大量有关土地购买和该团体想法的信息。该网站包括新住宅、农场、带有太阳能电池板的田地、人们坐在船上钓鱼和在中心城区吃饭的图画。

;

;自 2018 年以来，该投资集团已购买了 202 平方公里的土地。投资者包括商界领袖劳伦·鲍威尔·乔布斯 (Laurene Powell Jobs)、科技投资者马克·安德森 (Marc Andreessen) 和 LinkedIn 联合创始人雷德·霍夫曼 (Reid Hoffman)。 California Forever 的帖子称，其 97% 的投资者是美国人。有人担心该投资集团来自美国境外

;
;;;文件 - LinkedIn 联合创始人 Reid Hoffman（左）与首席执行官 Jeff Weiner 坐在 LinkedIn 加利福尼亚州山景城总部的大厅里2013 年 5 月 7 日星期二。（美联社照片/Noah Berger）;
;

;该项目对投资者来说听起来不错，但当地领导人和;居民;并不确定他们是否愿意同意。

;

;首先，许多人对该组织的保密性感到不安。投资者以“Flannery Associates LLC”的名义进行了购买。

;

;迈克·汤普森 (Mike Thompson) 代表美国国会下议院的该地区。他表示，美国财政部和联邦调查局一直在努力查明谁是土地购买的幕后黑手。

;

;“他们的保密造成了很多问题，耗费了大量时间和大量时间。” ;费用;，”汤普森说。

;

;投资者表示，他们需要对自己的身份保密，直到拥有足够的土地。现在他们正在讨论该项目，他们表示希望与索拉诺的居民进行对话。该小组首先向房主发送了一份;调查;。

;

;该调查询问了居民他们对索拉诺县未来的期望。居民的答案包括更低的生活成本、更多好工作、以及改善的学校和免受犯罪的安全。

;

;索拉诺县居民华盛顿公主对加州永远的计划持怀疑态度。华盛顿是索拉诺市中心 Suisun 市的代理市长。她说，许多居住在该地区的人不希望开发。他们希望保持特拉维斯空军基地附近地区的开放。

;

;她说，她担心弗兰纳里集团希望通过错误地说法创建一个“精英城市”他们计划建造低成本住宅。

;

;她想知道为什么该团体不想;改造;已经存在的城市。

;

;“更好的事情是;接触;我们的城市领导并在城市范围内与我们合作。不是为了创建一座新城市。”

;

;今年早些时候，弗兰纳里对一群土地所有者提起诉讼，也面临着愤怒。弗兰纳里说，土地所有者正在共同努力，确保土地只以高价出售。

;

;其他居民表示，最近该组织发出了一项调查，他们才开始担心。它询问社区对“一个重大新项目……拥有数万套新住宅”的支持程度。汤普森代表表示，他不确定 Sramek 和其他投资者是否了解索拉诺县或其价值观.

;
;;;市长 Ron Kott 手持一张地图，显示 Flannery Associates 在加利福尼亚州里约维斯塔市政厅，2023 年 8 月 30 日星期三。硅谷亿万富翁和投资者在索拉诺县进行了长达数年的秘密土地购买热潮，购买了超过 78 平方英里（202 平方公里）的农田，创建新城市的目标。 （美联社照片/Godofredo A. Vásquez）;
;

;他说 Sramek 认为他的财务专业知识将帮助开发商比其他加州住宅建筑商更快地推进项目。

; < p>;“他没有计划，还没有实现。”汤普森说。

;

;许多房屋建筑商表示，加州是一个很难开展业务的地方，因为该行业需要遵循许多规则。< /p>;

;

;

;霍夫曼和安德森没有回复通过电子邮件发送的置评请求，乔布斯也没有通过她的公司艾默生集体回复。

;

;项目开发商表示他们将保护军事基地以及想要继续在自己的土地上耕种的农民。

;

;我是 Dan Friedell。我是 Caty Weaver。

;;文件 - 足球迷在海洋赌场度假村的体育博彩休息室等待开球新泽西州大西洋城，2018 年 9 月 9 日。（美联社照片/Wayne Parry，档案）;
;

;美国肯塔基州的人们将能够合法;投注; 九月份首次参加体育赛事。当他们这样做时，他们还帮助支付有史以来第一个帮助有;赌博;问题的人的州计划。

;

;五年前，美国最高法院为赌博合法化扫清了道路。体育博彩。此后，美国近四分之三的州允许体育博彩，但对问题赌博服务的支持有限。现在，更多像肯塔基州这样的州至少需要一些体育博彩资金来帮助;上瘾;赌徒。

;

;研究表明，年轻、受过高等教育的男性最有可能成为其中的一员。投注体育运动。科技让赌博变得更加容易。在许多州，人们现在可以全天 24 小时通过智能手机应用程序进行投注。人们不仅可以对比赛的获胜者进行投注，还可以对比赛期间发生的各种事件进行投注。

;

;在过去五年中，合法的体育博彩为地方和州政府带来了 30 亿美元的税收。然而，各州在问题赌博服务上的支出很少。

;

;2022 年，马萨诸塞州为问题赌博服务预算了 1000 万美元。其他九个州没有花费任何费用。赌博所得的大部分资金都用于电话求助热线、;咨询;和公众宣传活动等服务。

;

;联邦政府花费数十亿美元用于药物滥用预防和治疗，肯塔基州预计第一年将在赌博问题上花费约 575,000 美元。

;

;迈克尔·R·斯通 (Michael R. Stone) 是非营利性组织肯塔基州问题赌博委员会的主任。 。他说这笔钱是一个好的开始，但是“我们目前在该州只有五名;认证;赌博顾问，而我们可能需要这个数量的五倍......”<截至一年前，15 个州和哥伦比亚特区制定了法律，要求体育博彩的部分资金用于问题赌博服务。但另外 15 个州没有这样做。

;

;此后，又有 7 个州推出了体育博彩或通过了相关法律。雷切尔·沃尔伯格说，所有这些人都要求将部分体育博彩资金用于问题赌博服务。她是马萨诸塞大学阿姆赫斯特分校的研究员。

;

;我是丹·诺瓦克。

; Mon, 11 Sep 2023 06:07:03 +0800 What Is the Goal of Japan’s New Moon Mission?https://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/what-is-the-goal-of-japan-s-new-moon-mission-/7259385.html

;;一枚 HII-A 火箭从鹿儿岛种子岛航天中心的发射台发射升空，日本南部，星期四，2023 年 9 月 7 日。（共同社，美联社）;
;

;上周，日本宇宙航空研究开发机构发射了一枚火箭，运载着旨在探索月球的航天器。

; <月球着陆器被称为“智能月球着陆器”（SLIM）。它的目标是明年初登陆月球表面。如果成功，日本将成为第五个将航天器登陆月球的国家。

;

;迄今为止，只有美国、俄罗斯、中国和印度成功地将航天器登陆月球。 ;印度登陆;发生在上个月。印度登陆的几天前，俄罗斯近 50 年来首次重返月球的尝试失败了。

;

;4 月，一家日本私营太空探索公司宣布推出其太空飞行器 ;在尝试登陆月球时坠毁;。如果这次着陆成功，这将标志着私人企业首次登陆月球。

;
;;;一枚 HII-A 火箭于 2023 年 9 月 7 日星期四从日本南部鹿儿岛种子岛航天中心的发射台升空。（美联社共同社新闻）;日本宇宙航空研究开发机构 (JAXA) 表示，在最近一次发射中，一枚 H-IIA 火箭于 9 月 7 日从日本西南部的种子岛航天中心升空。发射几小时后，日本宇宙航空研究开发机构表示正在接收来自 SLIM 航天器的信号，表明其运行正常。据路透社报道，预计将于 2 月开始登月过程。

;

;日本太空官员表示，SLIM 的目标是在月球表面目标区域 100 米范围内着陆。着陆器的目的或任务是测试航天器降落在非常具体的目标上的可能性。

;

;日本宇宙航空研究开发机构（JAXA）总裁山川博（Hiroshi Yamakawa）在新闻发布会上表示，该任务旨在证明未来航天器将能够着陆能够在“我们想要的地方”着陆，而不仅仅是“在我们能着陆的地方”。

;

;SLIM 将在月球东南半部一个名为 Mare Nectaris 的区域着陆。该区域包含凝固熔岩;平原;，从地球上看像是一片黑暗区域。

;

;着陆后，SLIM 将尝试检查富含矿物质的岩石，以寻找有关月球形成的线索。发展。飞船上没有搭载月球探测器。

;

;SLIM 是一个小型着陆器。它的重量略高于700公斤。 JAXA 计划在未来使用更多的轻型航天器，以降低发射成本并允许执行更多任务。

;
;;;2023 年 9 月 7 日星期四，一枚 HII-A 火箭从日本南部鹿儿岛种子岛航天中心的发射台发射升空。（美联社共同社新闻）;
;

;航天器使用化学;推进;系统，并配备了非常小的电子设备来控制着陆器。 SLIM 的总体开发成本约为 1.02 亿美元。

;

;发射 SLIM 的火箭还搭载了 X 射线成像和光谱任务 (XRISM) 卫星。这部分任务是日本宇宙航空研究开发机构、美国航天局NASA和欧洲航天局的联合项目。

;

;着陆器在发射后约45分钟成功与火箭分离。 XRISM 发射后不久，夏威夷和日本的地面站就收到了信号。 JAXA 表示，这证实了卫星的太阳能设备已成功部署。

; ;

;XRISM 卫星的设计拍摄多种波长的 X 射线图像并研究高温下物质中存在的化学物质。它可以收集有关星系之间的速度和构成的信息。这可以帮助科学家更好地了解恒星和星系是如何形成的。该卫星配备了观察不同波长或光谱的 X 射线，甚至是能量水平非常高的 X 射线。

;

;日本宇宙航空研究开发机构 (JAXA) 还计划与印度联合执行月球任务空间研究组织将在 2025 年之后的某个时间。这将涉及日本的 H3 火箭，将印度的下一个月球着陆器送入太空。

;

;作为美国宇航局的阿尔忒弥斯计划。

;

;我是布莱恩·林恩。

; Mon, 11 Sep 2023 06:07:03 +0800 Tennis Looks for Solutions to Tennis Ball Wastehttps://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/tennis-looks-for-solutions-to-tennis-ball-waste/7257172.html
;;2023 年 9 月 9 日星期六 21:55:01 GMT;
;;
;;美国网球公开赛期间，一盒比赛用过的网球被装在回收箱中网球锦标赛，2023 年 9 月 4 日星期一，在纽约。美联社照片/Eduardo Munoz Alvarez);
;

;网球运动存在一个浪费问题，许多球员甚至在每次打开新的比赛用球容器时都没有意识到。

; < p>;球不可;回收;。每年生产的 3.3 亿个球几乎全部进入废物或垃圾填埋场。一旦到达那里，球可能需要长达 400 年的时间才能;分解。;主要的职业网球比赛在两周的比赛中会消耗近 100,000 个球。

;

;网球的问题球废料已促使球制造商、网球官员和回收公司寻找解决方案。

;

;尼古拉斯·J·塞梅利斯 (Nickolas J. Themelis) 是哥伦比亚大学地球工程中心主任。

;

;“网球就像很多物体都被设计得坚不可摧，这意味着它们对机械加工具有很强的抵抗力，”他说。

;

;“但是你是否会拿一个可以永久使用的有用物体并说人们不应该使用它？因为它永远持续下去？这是无稽之谈。”他补充道。

;

;Themelis 和其他专家指出，在每年产生的数亿吨垃圾中，网球所占的比例很小。他说解决方案的一部分是找到用球做其他事情的方法。

;

;“任何人说你不应该因为网球而打网球的人都是错误的，”该公司的主管 Jason Quinn 说。科罗拉多州立大学可持续发展研究实验室。他补充说，“你可以采取一些措施来重复使用和改变网球的用途，以减轻影响。”

;

;单个用过的球有时会成为狗的玩具，或者以其他小方式重新使用。但是，大量用过的球也可以; ;粉碎成碎片，用作建筑材料，例如地板。

;

;;网球材料;

;

;不过，专家和环保组织表示，这仍然没有解决网球回收的问题。球的外层柔软;层;，称为毛毡，牢固地附着在柔软的中心上。毛毡是羊毛和尼龙的组合，无法回收。

;
;;;2023 年 9 月 4 日星期一在纽约举行的美国网球公开赛期间，一箱比赛用的网球放在运输箱中。 （美联社照片/Eduardo Munoz Alvarez）;
;

;此外，顶级球的中心是用橡胶树的橡胶制成的。环保组织表示，这会导致亚马逊地区的森林砍伐。

;

;贾森·柯林斯 (Jason Collins) 是威尔逊体育用品公司 (Wilson Sporting Goods) 国际;球拍;运动业务主管。他说，它的顶级球使用直接来自树木的橡胶。不过，他说威尔逊还生产其他含有回收橡胶材料的网球。

;

;;解决这个问题;

;

;国际网球联合会 (ITF) 是一个职业网球的管理机构。去年，ITF 召集了制造商、网球官员和回收商，开始解决网球问题。该小组正在努力寻找以下问题的答案：有没有办法设计一个完全可回收的球？ ITF 能否改变规则，让球在比赛中使用更长时间？各种球在不同级别的比赛中表现如何？

;

;目前，职业球员在前七场比赛后更换一套新球，然后每九场比赛后更换一套新球。

;

;Jamie Capel-Davies 是 ITF 的科技主管。他说，减少浪费的努力有四个层次。

;

;“首先，尝试减少正在使用的球的数量。然后尽可能重复使用球。回收是第三个，”他说。

;

;第四个层次是处置，意味着将球放入垃圾填埋场。大多数球都被扔进垃圾填埋场。

;

;制造商和回收商已开始采取措施减少和重复使用球。

;

;Wilson Sporting Goods 推出了 Triniti 球，该球可以更长时间地保持球芯内的空气，并且具有感觉更强烈。

;

;总部位于佛蒙特州的 RecycleBalls 表示，预计今年将从美国和加拿大各地收集 300 万个网球。

;

;“我们相信网球有多重生命， “RecycleBalls 领导人艾琳·坎宁安 (Erin Cunningham) 说道。但是，该组织不希望用过的球永远留在他们的存储中心。

;

;“我们需要确保后端;实际上;有对回收产品的需求， ”坎宁安说。

;

;哥伦比亚大学的塞梅利斯认为，网球的最终安息地不应该是垃圾填埋场，而应该是燃烧垃圾发电的垃圾发电厂。

;

;然而，反对者这个想法说，燃烧球来发电也会增加空气污染。他们说有更好、更清洁的新用途。

;

;我是安德鲁·史密斯。我是吉娜·贝内特。

; Sun, 10 Sep 2023 06:07:03 +0800 Warren Harding: Damagedhttps://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/americas-presidents-warren-harding/4018013.html
;;2023 年 9 月 9 日星期六 21:58:27 GMT;

;;沃伦·哈丁：已损坏;< /div>;

;美国之音学习英语节目介绍美国总统。

;

;今天我们谈论的是沃伦·哈丁。他是美国第 29 任总统。

;
;;;沃伦·哈丁总统;
;

;哈丁与第 28 任总统有很大不同，伍德罗·威尔逊。

;

;威尔逊支持变革；哈丁承诺“恢复正常”。

;

;威尔逊采取措施保护美国工人；哈丁经常致力于保护企业主。

;

;威尔逊在支持女性投票权以及接受非洲裔美国人与白人平等方面进展缓慢。哈丁支持妇女选举权和非裔美国人的公民权利。

;

;然而，两人在任职期间都很受欢迎。

;

;然而，今天，历史学家通常认为威尔逊是美国的一位伟大人物。最好的总统。但哈丁被认为是最糟糕的总统之一。

;

;;早年;

;

;沃伦·哈丁是俄亥俄州第八任总统。他的父母都是医生。

;

;哈丁谈到了他和兄弟姐妹在农场长大的快乐童年。他最喜欢的一些早期活动是在乐队中表演。;

;

;后来，哈丁和两个朋友一起买了一份报纸。这篇论文的成功有;几个原因;。

;

;哈丁对他很友善员工并与他们分享公司的利润。他还尽量不发表批评任何政党的政治或政客的报道。最后，他娶了一位具有出色商业头脑的女人。

;

;;弗洛伦斯·克林·哈丁; 领导报纸的;发行量; ;部门;。她还帮助指导了丈夫的政治生涯。

;
;;;弗洛伦斯·哈丁（Florence Harding）与总统合影，她之前曾短暂结婚并育有一个儿子。她和沃伦·哈丁没有生育孩子。;
;

;后来，沃伦·哈丁成为州参议员、俄亥俄州副州长，然后成为美国参议院议员。他特别喜欢当参议员——许多其他立法者也喜欢他。

;

;其中一个;原因;是因为哈丁很少在任何问题上采取有争议的立场。

;

;相反，他接受了共和党的大部分想法。他长得也很帅，说话声音也很好。

;

;这些品质帮助他赢得了 1920 年共和党总统提名。几个月后，他轻松赢得了全国大选。

;

; >;;总统任期;

;

;哈丁总统在第一次世界大战结束后不久就任。他承诺让美国人再次感到平静，并提高国家的;繁荣;。哈丁的两个目标是支持商业和限制移民。

;

;他在这两个问题上都取得了成功。他的政府减少了大企业和富人的税收。它还提高了关税——对外国进口商品征税。

;

;哈丁政府实施了;移民新规定;。这些规则使来自北欧的移民更容易进入该国，但对来自俄罗斯、东欧和中欧的移民则更困难。

;

;哈丁还采取措施提高联邦政府的效率。

;

;哈定还采取了措施来提高联邦政府的效率。 >;

;但他的政府主要因其问题而被人们铭记。

;
;;;众所周知，哈丁在白宫饮酒，尽管第十八修正案禁止饮酒。他还喜欢玩扑克，有一次赌掉了一套白宫菜肴。;
;

;据报道，在上任之初，哈丁告诉朋友们，担任总统的工作对他来说太难了。他似乎想做得好，而且他很努力。但他把大部分责任交给了内阁里的朋友。

;

;其中有一些人非常能干。但有些人不诚实。他们滥用职权为自己和家人谋取财富。

;

;哈丁执政期间最著名的腐败例子之一是;茶壶圆顶丑闻;。

;

;“茶壶圆顶”这个名字来自于怀俄明州的一块岩石。这块岩石看起来像一个茶壶。科学家们正确地认为，可以在其下方的地下找到石油。

;

;当时，美国海军依靠石油为其船只提供燃料。 So, the federal government claimed the land in case the navy needed to use the oil in an emergency.

;

;But a cabinet official who was a friend of Harding took control of the land. He gave a private company permission to search for oil on it in exchange for a large amount of money.

;

;Some lawmakers became suspicious. So they opened an investigation.

;
;;;President Warren Harding's first cabinet, 1921;
;

;In time, lawyers proved the act of corruption. Harding's friend was the first person to be found guilty of a crime while serving as a cabinet official.

;

;But President Harding did not live to see his friend go to jail.

;

;The investigation was just beginning when Harding took a trip to the West Coast to campaign for his policies.

;

;Some say that Harding was also trying to escape the problems in his administration. He reportedly told one reporter that worrying about what his friends were doing kept him awake at nights.

;

;During the trip, Harding showed signs of not being in good health. Doctors thought he could have food poisoning or pneumonia. He was taken to a hotel in San Francisco, California. For a day, he appeared to be feeling better.

;

;He was sitting up in bed. And then suddenly, his body shook and collapsed. He died ;instantly;.

;

;Reports at the time differed on the cause of Harding's death. Some even said that his wife poisoned the president to protect him from being punished for the wrongdoing in his administration.

;

;But most historians think that he had long suffered from heart failure, and was struck by a heart attack. He was 57.

;

;;Legacy ;

;

;Millions of Americans mourned over Warren Harding's death. They stood beside railroad tracks as his body traveled from California back to Washington, DC.

;

;The following year, Florence Harding also died. She and her husband are buried together under a ;grand; memorial in their hometown in Ohio.

;

;But in the years after his death, Harding's public image worsened. More corruption scandals in his administration came to light. And some historians have criticized him for not having a clear idea about how he wanted to lead the country.

;
;;;Nan Britton, pictured here, wrote a book called "The President's Daughter.";
;

;In 1927, a woman published a book saying she had a long, but secret relationship with Harding, both before and during his presidency. She also said he was the father of her daughter. Genetic testing has confirmed her claim.

;

;More than 30 years after her book was published, a lawyer discovered love letters from Harding to a different woman. They confirmed that he had a long romantic affair with the wife of one of his friends. Harding had also been married at the time.

;

;These reports, as well as the corruption during his administration, damaged Harding's public image. But he also seemed to know that he would not be remembered as one of the best occupants of the White House.

;

;Instead, he tried to be likable and modest. He called himself “a man of limited ;talents;” who was “not fit for the office” of president.

;

;I'm Kelly Jean Kelly.

;;FILE - A stork lands in its nest near the young storks in Herzogenaurach, Germany, Tuesday, June 22, 2021. (AP Photo/Matthias Schrader,);
;

;And now, ;Words and Their Stories, ;from VOA Learning English.

;

;On this program we explore words and expressions in the English language. We give definitions, examples, and notes on usage.

;

;Today we talk about a word from the animal world – a nest. For some animals, especially birds, a nest is a shelter and a place to raise their young. So, it should not be surprising that we use the word “nest” to talk about our homes.

;

;A nest can describe a ;comfortable; home. And if you like ;to nest;, you like to make your home ;comfy and cozy;. In fact, a childbirth expert may tell pregnant women to expect strong ;nesting; feelings to develop late in their pregnancy. This common experience is a way a woman's body prepares for the arrival of the new baby.

;

;However, ;feathering your nest; is quite a different thing. If you ;feather your own nest;, you are not making your home comfortable by adding feathers. You are making yourself rich, especially in a way that is unfair or dishonest.

;

;But let's get back to nesting.

;

;An ;empty nest; is a family home where the children have grown up and left. So, an ;empty nester; is a parent whose children have grown up and left home.

;

;Some parents may feel sad or lost when they become empty nesters. This is called ;empty nest syndrome;. While parents may feel sad, most children are happy to become ;independent; and ;fly the coop;. “To fly the coop” is a very informal expression that means the children have left the family home.

;

;A coop is a small structure people make for ;domesticated; birds -- namely chickens: hens and roosters. We call these shelters either a “chicken coop” or a “hen house.” But, for some reason, we never say “hen coop” or “chicken house.”

;

;Online, you might see the expression “fly the nest.” That might be more of a British English saying. In the States, when often “fly the coop” rather than “fly the nest” to mean children have left home.

;

;However, the expression “fly the coop” has another meaning. If someone flies the coop, they leave suddenly or secretly. For example, we could say a criminal who ;snuck out of; prison flew the coop.

;

;And that's all the time we have for this ;Words and Their Stories;. Once you are finished learning all the English you can, you might have to fly the VOA Learning English coop! But until that happens, keep listening!

;

;Until next time … I'm Anna Matteo.

;

;

;

;

; Sun, 10 Sep 2023 06:07:03 +0800 Thirteen US Universities Form a Free Speech Grouphttps://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/thirteen-us-universities-form-a-free-speech-group/7238561.html
;;Sat, 09 Sep 2023 22:01:57 GMT;
;;
;;FILE - In this May 15, 2016 file photo, students embrace as they arrive for the Rutgers graduation ceremonies in Piscataway, New Jersey. (AP Photo/Mel Evans);
;

;Thirteen American colleges and universities recently announced the creation of a plan to support freedom of speech.

;

;The plan is part of an effort designed to fight what the schools call threats to US democracy.

;

;Among the schools taking part are Cornell University in New York state; Rutgers University in New Jersey; Notre Dame, the Catholic university in the Midwestern state of Indiana; and Benedict College, a historically Black school in South Carolina.

;

;The effort is called The Campus Call for Free Expression. The organizer of the group is The Institute for Citizens and Scholars based in Princeton, New Jersey. It is paid for by the Knight Foundation, a private group based in Miami, Florida. The aim is to build respect for freedom of expression in colleges. Another goal is to help students bring opposing groups together.

;

;The effort for free speech comes after students at several schools blocked people invited to speak in recent years. The students said they disagreed with the writings, comments, ideas or actions of the invited speaker.

;

;Jonathan Alger is the president of James Madison University in Virginia, one of the schools in the group. He said the group is concerned about “deep ;polarization;” in the US where people cannot discuss their different ideas in “;constructive; and civil ways.” He said colleges and universities need to be an example for the nation.

;

;The group started preparing for The Campus Call for Free Expression in March 2022. That was when college presidents gathered to discuss ways to get their students involved in democracy.

;
;;;FILE - James Madison University students walk to commencement in Harrisonburg, Virginia, May 5, 2017. The university is one of 13 across the United States that will focus on free speech in the coming year. (Stephen Swofford/Daily News-Record Via AP);
;

;The group came up with five ;principles; of free expression and pushed for each school to design its own programs. The principles are to be used for new student ;orientations;, educator training and special campus gatherings called convocations.

;

;The principles include developing knowledge that ;challenges; common beliefs and ;assumptions;; reaching decisions based on evidence; understanding one's own values and gaining respect for others who have different opinions; feeling a sense of responsibility to others and the need to work toward change; and learning that free expression has ;consequences; and does not always lead to approval.

;

;Jonathan Holloway is the president at Rutgers. He said he saw a growing lack of respect for American ;institutions,; and he wanted to push back against those feelings. In a discussion with the Associated Press, he said he was concerned by seeing the Confederate flag marched through the US Capitol building during the riot on January 6, 2021. “That's when things ;shifted; for me,” he said.

;

;Holloway will lead a first-year class at Rutgers this year that looks at the meaning of democracy. The aim is for the class to create a program that will improve civic education.

;

;The nonprofit groups who are supporting the presidents say they are concerned that students may not be learning about how to be good citizens while in college.

;

;Rajiv Vinnakota is president of the Institute for Citizens and Scholars. He said students become part of a community with more different kinds of people than they have ever experienced while in college. He wants students to learn how to interact with people who have different opinions and experiences. And he hopes the 13 schools will be able to lead the way for others who will soon join the group.

;

;Vinnakota questioned if educators can “get above” issues of free expression to get people to see that higher education “can and should” play a leading part in what he called “civic preparedness.”

;
;;;FILE - Student leaders and a professor at Duke University lead a presentation for new international students.;
;

;Some other colleges and universities in the group include Wellesley College in Massachusetts, Wesleyan University in Connecticut, Claremont McKenna College in California, Duke University in North Carolina and the University of Pittsburgh in Pennsylvania.

;

;The Knight Foundation gave Vinnakota's institute $250,000 to organize discussions among university leaders over the next year-and-a-half.

;

;Alberto Ibargüen is the head of the Knight Foundation. He said the group is interested in supporting the project because, “we believe in the free exchange of ideas…we believe in an informed citizenry…”

;

;PEN America is a nonprofit group that works with colleges and universities on free expression programs. It is not involved in the Campus Call for Free Expression. Kristen Shahverdian is the group's Free Expression and Education program senior manager. She said her group tells students about writers and artists around the world who have faced attacks or suffered for their ideas.

;

;“They understand the ;ramifications; of ;squashing; another's speech,” she said.

;

;Lucas Morel is a professor of politics at Washington and Lee University in Virginia who is not involved in the project. He is the head of a group called the Academic Freedom Alliance. He said more universities should work on programs that permit students to learn by discussing different evidence-based ideas. He said colleges are not just for helping students get a job, but they should help young people become citizens who care about the world around them.

;

;“If we don't do a good job of helping them be careful readers and careful listeners, it stands to reason that as citizens they won't be careful listeners and careful expressers of their own thought,” he said. “And it will be difficult for us to ;function; as a self-governing society.”

;

;I'm Faith Pirlo. And I'm Dan Friedell.

;

;

;

;;Dan Friedell adapted this story for Learning English based on a report by the Associated Press.;

; Sun, 10 Sep 2023 06:07:03 +0800 Newly Discovered Comet Won“t Return for 400 Yearshttps://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/newly-discovered-comet-won-t-return-for-400-years/7258473.html
;;Sat, 09 Sep 2023 22:03:29 GMT;

;;This image provided by Gianluca Masi shows the comet C/2023 P1 Nishimura and its tail seen from Manciano, Italy on Sept. 5, 2023. (Gianluca Masi via AP);
;

;A newly discovered comet is passing through our solar system for the first time in more than 400 years.

;

;Scientists say star watchers across the Northern Hemisphere should look to the sky as soon as possible, either this week or early next. They say it will be another 400 years before the comet returns to our neighborhood.

;

;The comet's official name is C/2023 P1 Nishimura. It is about one kilometer wide. Comet Nishimura will travel to within 125 million kilometers of the Earth on September 12.

;

;The comet was discovered in August by a Japanese star watcher, Hideo Nishimura. He discovered the comet using 30-second-long ;exposures; with a digital camera.

;

;The American space agency NASA says the comet has increased in brightness as it crosses our solar system. As the comet heads closer to the Sun, it will continue to get brighter.

;

;Early risers should look toward the northeastern ;horizon; about 90 minutes before sunrise. The comet will be less than 10 ;degrees; above the horizon making it difficult to see.

;

;Paul Chodas is head of NASA's Center for Near-Earth Object Studies. He said, “You really need a good pair of ;binoculars; to pick it out and you also need to know where to look.”

;

;The comet will come closest to the sun on about September 17. Then it will leave the solar system. Chodas said that the comet is “likely to survive its passage,” meaning he does not believe it will burn up near the sun.

;

;Italian astronomer Gianluca Masi is the founder of the Virtual Telescope Project. He said in an email to the Associated Press that the next week represents “the last, ;feasible; chances” to see the comet from the Northern Hemisphere before it is lost in the sun's ;glare;.

;

;“The comet looks amazing right now, with a long, highly structured tail, a joy to image with a telescope,” he said.

;

;If it survives its passage by the sun, the comet should be visible in the Southern Hemisphere by the end of September, Masi said.

;

;Professional astronomers use powerful telescopes around the world to watch the sky. It is unusual for a non-professional sky watcher to discover a comet these days. Chodas of NASA said of Nishimura's discovery, “This is his third find, so good for him.”

;

;The comet last visited about 430 years ago, Chodas said.

;

;I'm Mario Ritter, Jr.

;

;

; Sun, 10 Sep 2023 06:07:03 +0800 Are Biofuels a Clean Source of Energy?https://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/are-biofuels-a-clean-source-of-energy-/7258528.html
;;Fri, 08 Sep 2023 21:55:41 GMT;
;;
;;Sprawling fields of sugar cane are visible near Meerut, India, on August, 30, 2023. (AP Photo/Altaf Qadri);
;

;India has proposed an alliance to speed up the development of biofuels to support energy ;transition; worldwide.

;

;Biofuel is a kind of fuel produced from agricultural products or organic waste.

;

;India plans to announce the alliance at the G-20 gathering in New Delhi. It is expected that more than 15 countries will sign up to be part of the alliance. The United States, Canada, and Brazil are among a few of the countries expected to join India in such an alliance.

;

;;What are biofuels?;

;

;Humans have used biofuels since ancient times. For example, humans burn wood and animal waste for cooking, heating, and light. They have gained popularity in recent years for their possibility to deliver cleaner energy than some other sources.

;

;Biofuels are grouped based on their source. Each group is known as a “generation.” First-generation biofuels come from food crops like corn and sugar cane. Second generation come from non-food crops and agricultural waste. And third-generation come from small plants called algae.

;

;Ethanol, biodiesel, and biogas are popular kinds of biofuels. They can be produced from any of these sources and are grouped based on the source from which they are produced. For example, ethanol produced from farm-grown corn is grouped as first-generation ethanol.

;
;;;Fermenters and tanks containing molasses sit at Bajaj Hindustan Sugar factory that produces ethanol, a type of biofuel, in Meerut, India, on August 23, 2023. (AP Photo/Altaf Qadri);
;

;;Are biofuels always a source of clean energy?;

;

;Biofuels are not always a clean source of energy. But it depends on how it is produced. A biofuel made from waste, for example, with ;renewable; energy to power the production, would have little or no ;greenhouse gas; production, making it a clean fuel. But when crops are grown to just produce biofuels, the fertilizer and nonrenewable fuels needed to produce the fuel make it much less clean.

;

;“If you look at the full life ;cycle; of producing biofuels, it's many times not clean,” said Lydia Powell. She is an energy policy researcher at the New Delhi-based Observer Research Foundation. She has followed developments related to biofuels for over 20 years.

;

;Biofuels can also mean land that could have produced food is being used for energy. They can add to deforestation when land is cleared for their production.

;

;Powell noted Europe's imports of plant-based palm oil from Indonesia and other East Asian countries to make biodiesel for cars and trucks. Those imports greatly fell after the European Union banned the sale of palm oil and other palm-based products when they could be linked to deforestation.

;

;“They were destroying natural forests to plant palm trees so you produce oil to export to Europe. When you destroy forests, you destroy large ;chunks; of carbon sinks,” Powell said.

;

;Those problems have led to debates about exactly how sustainable biofuels are.

;

;;What are biofuels used for?;

;

;Biofuels are often used for transportation of people and products.

;

;Experts say once they are made, biofuels produce little to no greenhouse gases when used. The same cannot be said with the ;fossil fuels; they are mixed with.

;

;But there is a hope that biofuels might completely replace fossil fuels to power airplanes and ships.

;

;“They are one; option ;among a larger set of solutions,” said Jane O'Malley of International Council on Clean Transportation, a Washington-based independent nonprofit.

;

;O'Malley said it is important to use the right kind of biofuel for the right purpose. She said it is important for countries using biofuels to move as quickly as possible to produce them with little to no greenhouse gas production.

;

;I'm Gregory Stachel.

;

;

;

;;Ange Adihe Kasongo and Benoit Nyemba reported this story for Reuters. Gregory Stachel adapted the story for VOA Learning English. ;

; Sat, 09 Sep 2023 06:07:03 +0800 Rolling Stones Announce First New Album in 18 Yearshttps://learningenglish.voanews.com/a/rolling-stones-announce-first-new-album-in-18-years/7258499.html
;;Fri, 08 Sep 2023 21:58:22 GMT;
;;
;;Rolling Stones band members Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and Ronnie Wood attend a launch event for their new album "Hackney Diamonds", at Hackney Empire in London, Britain, September 6, 2023. (REUTERS/Toby Melville);
;

;
; The Rolling Stones said this week that their first new collection of songs in almost 20 years comes out on October 20.

;

;The album will be called ;Hackney Diamonds;. The name comes from broken glass often seen on the streets of east London's Hackney area.

;

;Three of the band's ;original; members - Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and Ronnie Wood – came to the Hackney Empire, a historic theater, for the announcement.

;

;The Rolling Stones are still traveling the world and performing concerts, but they have not made an album since 2016. That recording did not include new material.

;

;Richards, 79, said the band only made a new album because Jagger wanted to sing. So they went to record new songs after almost 20 years.

;

;“When you have a singer that wants to sing,” Richards said, “you ;grab; him and throw him in the studio.” Richards said the songs came together with “energy and urgency.”

;
;;;FILE - In this June 4, 2014, file photo, Rolling Stones singer Mick Jagger, performs with Keith Richards, second left, Ronnie Wood, left, and drummer Charlie Watts during a concert in Hayrkon Park in Tel Aviv, Israel. (AP Photo/Ariel Schalit, File);
;

;Jagger, who is 80, said, “we are quite pleased,” with the new album. He said the group would not have put a recording together if “we hadn't really liked it. We said we had to make a record we really love ourselves … we hope you all like it.”

;

;They released the first song, called ;Angry;, this week. But Jagger said the rest of the songs are not angry. He said the album contains “love songs, ;ballads;, country…” sounds.

;

;The new recording includes songs with Paul McCartney, Lady Gaga, Stevie Wonder and Charlie Watts, the Rolling Stones ;drummer; who died in 2021. Watts recorded sounds for two songs in 2019. Steve Jordan is the drummer for the other 10.

;

;“Of course, he's missed incredibly,” Richards said about Watts. But he added that Jordan was Watts' suggestion for a ;replacement;.

;

;Jagger said the addition of Lady Gaga to the album was unplanned. The Stones were recording at a ;studio; in Los Angeles and Lady Gaga just happened to be in the studio next door. So, she recorded the song ;Sweet Sound of Heaven; with the band.

;
;;;FILE - Lady Gaga arrives at the Oscars on Sunday, March 12, 2023, at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. (Photo by Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP);
;

;“She walked in next to me and we started singing together,” Jagger said.

;

;Wood said McCartney of the Beatles played the bass guitar on one ;track;. “You know, he was loving it.” McCartney's band was perhaps the Rolling Stones' biggest ;rival; in the 1960s.

;

;Taric Fioravanti was one of the fans who lined up outside hoping to see the band arrive. He is from Brazil. “I love these guys,” he said. “They're 80 years old. Most bands have stopped making music by that age,” he added.

;

;The Rolling Stones started in 1962. They celebrated their 60th year with a tour of Europe in 2022 and they said they have plans to visit North America in 2024.

;

;Wood, 76, plays guitar. He said the idea of retirement is “Impossible. You've got to keep playing,” he added.

;

;I'm Dan Friedell.

;
